mods:name.mods:affiliation: Unitat de Botànica, Departament de Biologia Animal, de Biologia Vegetal i d’Ecologia, Facultat de Biociències, Universitat Autònoma de Barcelona, 08193 Cerdanyola del Vallès (Barcelona), Spain.
Natural History Museum of Denmark (Zoological Museum), University of Copenhagen, Universitetsparken 15, 2100 København Ø, Denmark.

figureCitation.captionText: Fig. 24. Ecteinomyces trichopterophilus Thaxt. A–E. Mature thalli. In C, a very slender and flexuous thallus with up to 43 receptacular cells, and in D a gigantic thallus, both from Acrotrichis intermedia. F. Immature thallus. Antheridia (an) are labelled in A and F. Scale bars: 50 µm. Photographs from slides ZMUC C-F-122497 (A–B, E–F), ZMUC C-F-122653 (C–D).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Proceedings of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences 38: 26 ( Thaxter 1902 )
. –
Misgomyces trichopterophilus (Thaxt.) Thaxt. ( Thaxter 1931: 304 )
[MB#280610].
–

materialsCitation.collectedFrom: On the elytra and abdomen of Trichopteryx Haldemani Lec.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Type
: “
On the elytra and abdomen of
Trichopteryx Haldemani Lec.
, Intervale , N.H. , August, 1901 ”; FH . [ USA ]

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 24.
Ecteinomyces trichopterophilus Thaxt. A
–E . Mature thalli. In C, a very slender and flexuous thallus with up to 43 receptacular cells, and in D a gigantic thallus, both from
Acrotrichis intermedia
. F . Immature thallus. Antheridia (an) are labelled in A and F. Scale bars: 50 µm. Photographs from slides ZMUC C-F-122497 (A–B, E–F), ZMUC C-F-122653 (C–D).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Found on species of
Acrotrichis
and
Baeocrara Thomson, 1859
(this host genus only in Poland ) (Col. Ptiliidae ) from America : USA , Chile , Argentina ( Majewski 2008 ), and Costa Rica ( Goldmann & Weir 2018 ); Europe : Italy , Germany , Spain , United Kingdom , Poland ( Majewski 2008 ), Finland ( Huldén 1983 ), Hungary (
Bánhegyi et al. 1985
), Belgium ( De Kesel & Rammeloo 1992 ), Denmark ( Høier 2009 ), Sweden ( Huggert 2010 ), the Netherlands (Haelewaters et al. 2014), Bulgaria (
Rossi et al. 2019a
), and Austria ( Rossi & Christian 2020 ).

DENMARK –
Østjylland (EJ)
• Horsens ; 55°51.580′ N , 9°50.646′ E ; NG59;
13 Apr. 1947
;
Høeg DrY0036
; Høeg det.; ZMUC C-F-124102
.

As a curiosity, Majewski (2008) mentioned that this species is exceptionally common in Poland and that it is fair to expect it to be common in other countries. In Denmark ,
E. trichopterophilus
is also extremely common and is rare not to find it in a collection with specimens of
Acrotrichis
. Thalli are very variable in receptacle length and perithecial neck. In Fig. 24D a gigantic thallus is photographed, and in Fig. 24 C we show a very slender and flexuous thallus with up to 43 cells in the receptacle. Majewski (1994b) described up to three morphological types , without any taxonomical rank. We are not capable of distinguishing these groups among the Danish specimens.
